H0.text: A fossil is the scientific evidence that confirmed the existence of a now-extinct fish that lived millions of years ago and had features possibly used to move on land.

H1.text: A description is the scientific evidence that scientists most likely found to confirm the existence of a fish that lived millions of years ago, had features possibly used to move on land, and is now extinct.

H2.text: A photograph is the scientific evidence that scientists most likely found confirming the existence of a fish that lived millions of years ago, had features possibly used to move on land, and is now extinct.

H3.text: A cave drawing is the scientific evidence that confirmed the existence of a fish that lived millions of years ago, had features that were possibly used to move on land, and is now extinct.

A4.text: In addition, the record can predict and fill gaps such as the discovery of Tiktaalik in the arctic of Canada.

A5.text: The transition itself can only be illustrated and corroborated by transitional fossils, which are never guaranteed to demonstrate a convenient half-way point.
